str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.
In like manner, similarly, in the same way, equally. Adverb from homoios; similarly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A little fish. Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of optos; a relish to other food, i.e., fish.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dia and didomi; to give throughout a crowd, i.e. Deal out; also to deliver over.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To recline, especially at a dinner-table. From ana and keimai; to recline.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
